data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps right. Move backwards and face forward.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you are taken right back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow directions 1,2,3,4,5 and 6, you can return to the beginning point. If you follow directions 4 and 6, you cannot return to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take first step. Take 5 steps. Take 1 step. Take 1 step and take 7 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Take 4 steps. Turn left 5. Take 5 steps. Thus, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You should take 10 steps first then turn left. So, you take 10 steps first then turn left and take 9 steps back to start. So, you take 8 steps next, then take 9 steps then take 3 steps then take 3 steps then take 3 steps then take 5 steps. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, it may take some time to get back to the starting point. If you do turn around, it may take some time to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn right 2 steps, you will return to the starting point. If you turn right 1 step, you will turn back at the starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around takes 8 steps. If you take 2 steps after going back around, you'd take 2 + 1 = 3 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you face forward, when you are taking a step forward, you are always facing forward. Forward-facing person takes 1 step by the right side, left-facing person takes 4 steps, right-facing person takes 6 steps. The answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 3 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To take 2 steps, you would take 3 steps. To take 7 steps, you would take 7 steps. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 1 step backward. Take 3 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
One must always step forward, with the eyes always forward. One must take one step backward. One must take 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 5 steps left. Take 2 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can make the first step go forward and the next step go backward. You can make the first step go backward and the second step go forward. It repeats itself until the person turns to the left. As you turn to the left, you take the first step to your left and that is the second step away. The final answer: No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps left. Take 3 steps left. Take 1 step left. Take 3 steps backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 4 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you only look left, you will take 9 steps left. You cannot do this move with your entire body. If you are facing left, you may take 3 steps left for 4 steps right. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 4 steps left. Take 3 steps forward. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

When you start with an X on the right side facing forwards and a Z on the left side facing forwards you still face forwards, so take 3 steps forward. When you start with an X on the right side of the street facing to right then you still face to right while taking 3 steps forward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 6 steps left. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
In this situation, you are taking backwards steps. In this case, you would take 3 steps right. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Turn right. Turn around. Turn left. Take 4 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 8 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After turning right, you will turn around and return to the starting point. After turning right, you will turn right and return to the starting point. The answer: Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Take 3 steps. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You can take 6 steps back to the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 9 steps and you are on the way back. Turn around and you are on the way back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 2 steps. Take 9 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Turn around and turn left for your first step. After 1 step, turn around and take 2 steps followed by 6 steps. After 1 step, turn around and take 7 steps followed by 3 steps. After 2 steps, turn around and take 7 steps followed by 1 step. After 2 steps, turn around and take 9 steps followed by 3 steps. After 2 steps, turn around and take 9 steps followed by 4 steps. After 4 steps, turn around and take 7 steps followed by 1 step. When 1 step is in front of 4 steps, turn around and take 1 step, followed by 5 steps. Take 2 steps to walk 1 step forward. When 1 step is in front of 4 steps, take 2 steps to walk 1 step backwards. Then when 1 step is in front of 4 steps (taking 7 steps taken backwards), turn around and take 4 steps to walk 1 step forward. When 2 steps are in front of 4 steps, take 2 steps to walk 2 steps backwards. Thus, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
After taking 1 step, you are back at your starting point. If you take 5 steps, you are back at your starting point. Thus, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 1 step. Take 1 step. Take 3 steps. Turn left. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 3 steps 1st. Turn left 3 steps 2nd. Take 2 steps 3rd. Take 3 steps 4th. Take 6 steps 6th. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 2 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around and take 10 steps again, you take 10 steps back. Thus, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
A person can return to their starting point by following the instructions in the first part without turning around. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 2 steps right. Take 5 steps backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 7 steps forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you take 8 steps left, you go backwards. You can not go backwards. If you have taken 5 steps backwards, you go forward. Similarly, if you face forward, you move left. The answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps backward. Take 9 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It requires a full 180 steps to change one direction. If you always face forward and get 5 steps backward, you are always facing forward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
It's always difficult to turn something around after it's started at the starting point. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps left. Take 6 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You always face forward. You can not make it to your starting point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Take 5 steps. Turn around. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you are only taking a few steps backward, you have to take 2 steps backward, which is one step backward. However, the number of steps in both directions is equal to one. The number of steps in both directions is equal to one. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 3 steps. Take 10 steps. Take 4 steps. Take 1 step. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take the first step. Take the 2nd step, then the 3rd step. Take the 4th step, then the 6th step. Take 1 step. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 9 steps. Turn around. Take 9 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around, you take 9 steps to return to the starting point. So, the answer is yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 10 steps right. Take 7 steps backward. Take 3 steps left. Take 8 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 8 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The phrase " always face forward" is quite misleading. The word " always face forward " actually means, always facing back. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Turn around. Turn around. Turn around. Take 1 step. Take 6 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you follow the instruction to take 7 steps, you return to the starting point. Taking 1 step makes you back in the beginning of the first rotation. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 9 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you always face forward, you do not always need to take 5 steps backward to get back to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 5 steps left. Take 1 step backward. Take 4 steps right. Take 1 step backward. Take 8 steps left. Take 6 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
To return to the starting point, you have to go backwards. If you are facing forward, you can’ t take a step backward. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 3 steps forward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 3 steps backward. Take 7 steps left. Take 7 steps right. Take 8 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Steps backward are always taken in the same direction as the steps you just took. Therefore, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn around. Take 2 steps. Take 8 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Turn around. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turning around involves two steps. This sequence does not return to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 6 steps forward. Take 4 steps forward. Take 9 steps backward. Take 1 step backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

Walking forwards you will always face forward. Walking backwards is always in one straight line. Walking forwards is another way to say walking backward. Just as in all directions, no one does not go to the starting point. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 5 steps. Take 5 steps. Take 7 steps. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Take 2 steps backwards. Take 2 steps forwards. Take 2 steps backwards. So, the answer is No.

Backwards steps are 3 backwards steps. Leftward steps are 2 steps. Backward and left steps are not the same thing. So, the answer is No.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 2 steps backward. Take 4 steps backward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you look down, you must follow the direction you are facing. If you look forward, you must face the direction you are facing. If you reverse, you must take both directions backward. So, the answer is no.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Turn left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The directions say you go around, take 10 steps, turn around and turn right, turn out left. Irregular sequence of steps will return you back to starting point. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 7 steps left. Take 8 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Take 4 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

You can always take 7 steps left and 8 steps right, but you must always face forward and you may not go backward. If you don't face forward, you must take 4 steps left and 8 steps right. So, the answer is No.

Take 9 steps forward. Take 5 steps right. Take 1 step forward. Take 3 steps right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

It takes 4 steps backward to get to the starting point. The starting point of the instructions can be located either right next to the starting point or you can also find it next to it on the map. You can also find it in the opposite direction as it is closest to you. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps forward. Take 9 steps forward. Take 3 steps left. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
The starting point is always facing forward. It is one step forward every time. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn right. So, the answer is No.

To get back to an original starting point, you can use the same directions as before; facing forward. So, the answer is No.

The instructions are to always face forward. The person in question's backward direction is always facing forward. So, the answer is No.

Take 1 step forward. Take 7 steps right. Take 1 step left. Take 1 step right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If someone is always facing forward, their back and front eyes are always facing forward. The answer: No.

First, face forward and go 1 step backward. A right turn is 6 steps right and take 12 steps right. Next, face upward and go 2 steps forward and take 1 step left. So, the answer is no.
